channel.title: Massive 8.8 quake hits Chile, over 100 dead
channel.description:
A huge magnitude-8.8 earthquake struck Chile early on Saturday, killing at least 122 people, knocking down homes and hospitals, and triggering a tsunami that rolled menacingly across the Pacific. Tsunami warnings were posted around the Pacific, including the U.S. state of Hawaii, Japan and Russia.
Now its time to help Chile and anywhere that gets hit by the tsunami! http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20100227/ts_nm/us_quake_chile

item.title: Massive 8.8 quake hits Chile, over 100 dead
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Kane.:

Eastern Australia got Tsnuami Warnings. shrug

Yeah, heard something like that today. Didn’t really care myself; if I die because of a big wave of water then that’s not such a bad way to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Massive 8.8 quake hits Chile, over 100 dead
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“R3volution`, post:14, topic:331027”][quote author=jme link=topic=427396.msg3139027#msg3139027 date=1267311786]
Watching the live stream of the tsunami hitting hawaii was quite boring. Basically there was quick tide changes but that’s all.
[/quote]

I watched live coverage from CNN but from what I was watching there wasnt much going on.[/quote]

Yeah, you couldn’t see much happening. The only thing noticable was watching this feed of some reef covering up with water on the 3rd and 4th wave. They said the tide normally takes 6 hours for it to do that, and it covered up in a couple of minutes. How boring.

I saw people on the beaches a few times. Too bad it didn’t hit because clearly they were idiots.

Read full topic
